subject: Learning
title: Motivation and Self-Regulation
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Motivation and Self-Regulation.

hook.text: You know you should study. You understand the strategy. You have the time. You still don't do it.

buildup.text: Self-regulation requires more than knowledge. It requires motivation to actually execute the plan.

discovery.text: Self-efficacyâ€”believing you can succeedâ€”is the fuel that powers self-regulation.

twist.text: Without self-efficacy, students know the right strategy but feel too helpless to use it.

climax.text: Building small wins generates self-efficacy, which powers larger efforts. Start easy, build momentum.

punchline.text: Knowing what to do isn't enough. You must believe you can.

quiz.question: What role does self-efficacy play in self-regulated learning?
options: It provides the belief and motivation needed to execute strategies
It replaces the need for any strategy
It only matters for physical skills, not academic learning
